mess up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to spoil or ruin something, especially something important or something that has been carefully planned
mess up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: It took me ages to get this right – I don’t want some idiot to mess it up.
She felt she’d messed up her whole life.
mess up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make something dirty or untidy
mess up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to make a mistake and do something badly
mess up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: I think I messed up on the last question.
It doesn’t matter if you mess it up, you can always try again.
mess up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to make someone have emotional or mental problems
mess up.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to hurt someone especially by hitting them
